info.description:
# kerbal-kassembler

Tested using Python 3.6.9

---

This project is a python module, which means that it is run in the following way:

`python3 -m kassembler`

## Module documentation:

---

Help can be acquired by:

`python3 -m kassembler --help`

---

## CURRENT LIMITATIONS:

---

It should be VERY well known that at the current stage in development these are the limitations of the code provided:

* This can only successfully assemble KASM files that only contain code in the _start part of the code. Support for other labels will come when the linker is updated to handle that.

---

### Required arguments:

kassembler requires one argument that corresponds to the path of the input .kasm file.

For example, if there was a file called `launch.kasm` it would be opened using:

`python3 -m kassembler launch.kasm`

This can be an absolute or relative path and should work on both linux and Windows, and possibly MacOS too.

---

### Optional arguments:

kassembler has the option of specifying the output file name and path.

This can be specified using `-o` / `--output`

The default output location is in the current working directory, to a file named the same as the input, just with a `.ko` extension instead

For example, if I wanted instead the output of my `launch.kasm` to be named `code_for_rocket.ksm` it would be done using the following:

`python3 -m kassembler launch.kasm -o code_for_rocket.ksm`

---

If you have any questions / suggestions let me know.

I SERIOUSLY need to write some comments, that should come as soon as function support is included.
info.name: kerbal-assembler
info.summary: Python program for assembling KerbalAssembly to KerbalObject files.
